intro: Galium benthamianum, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features opposite, slender stems and small, opposite leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Galium benthamianum produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds.
